reviews.review_msg: His modules were very brief and only cover a very small part of the exam. The content of the course itself is honestly not that hard for an upper division BPK course. However he made it much harder than it is by assigning huge textbook chapters for exams.

The Canvas course is very test heavy with 80% of your mark coming from the midterm and final. Modules do not help in your preparation for the exam so get ready to read the entire textbook. Exams did not seem to focus on main concepts or big picture ideas but rather asked about random bits of information from the textbook that you would not expect.

Part 1:  BPK 311 with this man was absolutely ridiculous.  Boring. Monotone. Mumbles. Soft spoken. 2 Hour lectures.  The lecture slides are poorly put together, they looked like Amandio realized he had to teach the class with a week left till the semester started so he Wikipedia'd a bunch of schnozz and threw together 8 lectures worth of crap.

His lectures are mono-toned, slow and not very interesting. This however makes the class really easy, even if you miss class, it's not hard to follow/catch up. He's not the best at answering questions during lecture but always comes back with the answer next class.
